verses.verse: Let me sing <S%H7891><s%> for my well beloved <S%H3039><s%> a song <S%H7892><s%> of my beloved <S%H1730><s%> about his vineyard. <S%H3754><s%> My beloved <S%H3039><s%> had a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> on a very fruitful <S%H1121><s%> hill. <S%H7161><s%>

He dug <S%H5823><s%> it up, <S%H5619><s%> gathered out its stones, planted <S%H5193><s%> it with the choicest vine, <S%H8321><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> a tower <S%H4026><s%> in its midst, <S%H8432><s%> and also cut <S%H2672><s%> out a winepress <S%H3342><s%> therein. <S%H6960><s%> He looked for it to yield <S%H6213><s%> grapes, <S%H6025><s%> but it yielded <S%H6213><s%> wild grapes. <S%H891><s%>
"Now, <S%H3427><s%> inhabitants of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> and men <S%H376><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> please judge <S%H8199><s%> between me and my vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

What could have been done <S%H6213><s%> more to my vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> that I have not done <S%H6213><s%> in it? <S%H4069><s%> Why, when I looked <S%H6960><s%> for it to yield <S%H6213><s%> grapes, <S%H6025><s%> did it yield <S%H6213><s%> wild grapes? <S%H891><s%>

Now I will tell <S%H3045><s%> you what I will do <S%H6213><s%> to my vineyard. <S%H3754><s%> I will take away <S%H5493><s%> its hedge, <S%H4881><s%> and it will be eaten up. <S%H1197><s%> I will break down <S%H6555><s%> its wall <S%H1447><s%> of it, <S%H4823><s%> and it will be trampled down.

I will lay <S%H7896><s%> it a wasteland. <S%H1326><s%> It won't <S%H2168><s%> be pruned nor hoed, <S%H5737><s%> but it will grow <S%H5927><s%> briers <S%H8068><s%> and thorns. <S%H7898><s%> I will also command <S%H6680><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> that they rain <S%H4305><s%> no rain on it. <S%H4305><s%>"

For the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies <S%H6635><s%> is the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> his pleasant <S%H8191><s%> plant: <S%H5194><s%> and he looked <S%H6960><s%> for justice, <S%H4941><s%> but, <S%H4939><s%> behold, oppression; for righteousness, <S%H6666><s%> but, <S%H6818><s%> behold, a cry of distress.

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who join <S%H5060><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> to house, <S%H1004><s%> who lay <S%H7126><s%> field <S%H7704><s%> to field, <S%H7704><s%> until there is no <S%H657><s%> room, <S%H4725><s%> and you are made to dwell <S%H3427><s%> alone in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the land! <S%H776><s%>

In my ears, <S%H241><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies <S%H6635><s%> says: <S%H3808><s%> "Surely many <S%H7227><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%> will be desolate, <S%H8047><s%> even great <S%H1419><s%> and beautiful, <S%H2896><s%> unoccupied. <S%H3427><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> acres <S%H6776><s%> of vineyard <S%H3754><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> one <S%H259><s%> bath, <S%H1324><s%> and a homer <S%H2563><s%> of seed <S%H2233><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> an ephah. <S%H374><s%>"

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who rise up early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> that they may follow <S%H7291><s%> strong drink; <S%H7941><s%> who stay <S%H309><s%> late into the night, <S%H5399><s%> until wine <S%H3196><s%> inflames them! <S%H1814><s%>

The harp, <S%H3658><s%> lyre, <S%H5035><s%> tambourine, <S%H8596><s%> and flute, <S%H5035><s%> with wine, <S%H3196><s%> are at their feasts; <S%H4960><s%> but they don't <S%H5027><s%> respect the work <S%H6467><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> neither have they considered <S%H7200><s%> the operation <S%H6467><s%> of his hands. <S%H3027><s%>

Therefore my people <S%H5971><s%> go into captivity <S%H1540><s%> for lack of knowledge. <S%H1847><s%> Their honorable <S%H3519><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> are famished, <S%H7458><s%> and their multitudes <S%H1995><s%> are parched <S%H6704><s%> with thirst. <S%H6772><s%>

Therefore Sheol <S%H7585><s%> has enlarged <S%H7337><s%> its desire, <S%H6310><s%> and opened <S%H6473><s%> its mouth <S%H6310><s%> without measure; <S%H2706><s%> and their glory, <S%H1926><s%> their multitude, <S%H1995><s%> their pomp, <S%H7588><s%> and he who rejoices <S%H5938><s%> among them, <S%H3381><s%> descend into it.
So man <S%H120><s%> is brought low, <S%H7817><s%> mankind <S%H120><s%> is humbled, <S%H8213><s%> and the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the arrogant <S%H1364><s%> ones are humbled; <S%H8213><s%>

but Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies <S%H6635><s%> is exalted <S%H1361><s%> in justice, <S%H4941><s%> and God <S%H410><s%> the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One is sanctified <S%H6942><s%> in righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>
Then the lambs <S%H3532><s%> will graze <S%H7462><s%> as in their pasture, <S%H1699><s%> and strangers <S%H1481><s%> will eat <S%H398><s%> the ruins <S%H2723><s%> of the rich. <S%H4220><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who draw <S%H4900><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> with cords <S%H2256><s%> of falsehood, <S%H7723><s%> and wickedness <S%H2403><s%> as with cart <S%H5699><s%> rope; <S%H5688><s%>

Who say, <S%H559><s%> "Let him make speed, <S%H4116><s%> let him hasten <S%H2363><s%> his work, <S%H4639><s%> that we may see <S%H7200><s%> it; <S%H6098><s%> and let the counsel of the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> draw near <S%H7126><s%> and come, <S%H935><s%> that we may know it! <S%H3045><s%>"

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who call <S%H559><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> good, <S%H2896><s%> and good <S%H2896><s%> evil; <S%H7451><s%> who put <S%H7760><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> for light, <S%H216><s%> and light <S%H216><s%> for darkness; <S%H2822><s%> who put <S%H7760><s%> bitter <S%H4751><s%> for sweet, <S%H4966><s%> and sweet <S%H4966><s%> for bitter! <S%H4751><s%>
Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who are wise <S%H2450><s%> in their own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and prudent <S%H995><s%> in their own sight! <S%H6440><s%>
Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who are mighty <S%H1368><s%> to drink <S%H8354><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> and <S%H582><s%> champions <S%H2428><s%> at mixing <S%H4537><s%> strong drink; <S%H7941><s%>
who acquit <S%H6663><s%> the guilty <S%H7563><s%> for <S%H6118><s%> a bribe, <S%H7810><s%> but deny <S%H5493><s%> justice <S%H6666><s%> for the innocent! <S%H6662><s%>

Therefore as the tongue of fire <S%H784><s%> devours <S%H398><s%> the stubble, <S%H7179><s%> and as the dry grass <S%H2842><s%> sinks down <S%H7503><s%> in the flame, <S%H3956><s%> so their root <S%H8328><s%> shall be as rottenness, <S%H4716><s%> and their blossom <S%H6525><s%> shall go up <S%H5927><s%> as dust; <S%H80><s%> because they have rejected <S%H3988><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> and despised <S%H5006><s%> the word <S%H565><s%> of the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Therefore Yahweh <S%H3068><s%>'s anger <S%H639><s%> burns <S%H2734><s%> against his people, <S%H5971><s%> and he has stretched out <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> against them, <S%H5221><s%> and has struck them. <S%H2022><s%> The mountains tremble, <S%H7264><s%> and their dead bodies <S%H5038><s%> are as refuse <S%H5478><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the streets. <S%H2351><s%> For all this, <S%H639><s%> his anger is not turned away, <S%H7725><s%> but his hand <S%H3027><s%> is still stretched out. <S%H5186><s%>

He will lift up <S%H5375><s%> a banner <S%H5251><s%> to the nations <S%H1471><s%> from far, <S%H7350><s%> and he will whistle <S%H8319><s%> for them from the end <S%H7097><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%> Behold, <S%H935><s%> they will come speedily <S%H4120><s%> and swiftly. <S%H7031><s%>

None shall be weary <S%H5889><s%> nor stumble <S%H3782><s%> among them; <S%H5123><s%> none shall slumber nor sleep; <S%H3462><s%> neither shall the belt <S%H232><s%> of their waist <S%H2504><s%> be untied, <S%H6605><s%> nor the latchet <S%H8288><s%> of their shoes <S%H5275><s%> be broken: <S%H5423><s%>

whose arrows <S%H2671><s%> are sharp, <S%H8150><s%> and all their bows <S%H7198><s%> bent. <S%H1869><s%> Their horses <S%H5483><s%>' hoofs <S%H6541><s%> will be like <S%H2803><s%> flint, <S%H6862><s%> and their wheels <S%H1534><s%> like a whirlwind. <S%H5492><s%>

Their roaring <S%H7581><s%> will be like a lioness. <S%H3833><s%> They will roar <S%H7580><s%> like young lions. <S%H3715><s%> Yes, <S%H5098><s%> they shall roar, and seize <S%H270><s%> their prey <S%H2964><s%> and carry it off, <S%H6403><s%> and there will be no one to deliver. <S%H5337><s%>

They will roar <S%H5098><s%> against them in that day <S%H3117><s%> like the roaring <S%H5100><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%> If one looks <S%H5027><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> behold, <S%H2822><s%> darkness and distress. <S%H6862><s%> The light <S%H216><s%> is darkened <S%H2821><s%> in its clouds. <S%H6183><s%>
